final_answer:
The humor and satire in this image come from the juxtaposition of two scenes. On the left, a boy is kneeling and holding his hand out to a cow, suggesting a peaceful, harmonious interaction with the animal. On the right, another boy is sitting with a big smile, enjoying a burger with sauce dripping from it.

The contrast between these two scenes highlights the irony of how people can show affection toward animals like cows but also consume products made from them without thinking about the contradiction. The text "YES, BUT" emphasizes this by acknowledging the affectionate interaction while also pointing out the conflicting reality represented by the burger. It's a commentary on how societal norms often separate our emotional connections from our dietary choices.
